## SDQ vs SFQ

The task of comparing and harmonizing psychological questionnaires like the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and Social Functioning Questionnaire (SFQ) can be a daunting one for researchers. While SDQ assesses behavioral aspects in children and adolescents, SFQ evaluates the social performance of adults. Directly comparing SDQ and SFQ on your own can be time-consuming and subjective, making it a challenge to discern the nuanced differences and similarities between the two. Thankfully, a solution to this problem lies in a tool called Harmony. This innovative software uses natural language processing and generative AI models to streamline the harmonization process. SDQ vs SFQ comparison becomes much more straightforward with Harmony. Researchers can upload their questionnaires onto the web interface and have the software highlight percentage matches between items from both questionnaires. Harmony's capability of handling multilingual documents makes it a universally applicable tool, gaining wide acceptance in the psychological research community. Harness the power of AI to ease your efforts in comparing SDQ vs SFQ and facilitate a more comprehensive understanding of your research data. Discover how your studies can benefit from the harmonisation process and visit https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app to explore more about Harmony. Maximise the value of your research with an optimized SDQ versus SFQ analysis using Harmony. See how this innovative tool can rapidly boost your productivity while maintaining a high level of accuracy in your research findings.

## Compare the items in SDQ and SFQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and SFQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SFQ into Harmony</a> - compare SFQ with other instruments
